settings.title: Mechanical Engineer | R&D Engineer | Additive Manufacturing | Space & Defense Tech Enthusiast
settings.summary: I am a research-driven mechanical design engineer specializing in additive manufacturing and complex mechanical systems. With hands-on experience across energy, aerospace, and medical domains, I leverage simulation-led development, rapid prototyping, and design optimization to deliver high-performance, manufacturable hardware solutions.

items.position: R & D Working Student in Additive Manufacturing
items.description: Executed additive manufacturing operations for chemical reactor components, supporting design, fabrication, and assembly of 2 reactor prototypes. Created 10+ BFDs, PFDs, and P&ID diagrams. Performed FEM simulations on reactor and heat exchanger components. Designed a gyroid-based heat exchanger with 30% surface area enhancement. Collaborated with a multidisciplinary engineering team to iterate reactor designs, reducing design-to-prototype cycle time by 25%. Utilized Siemens NX & CATIA for design and ANSYS for validation.

Led and collaborated with a team to resolve 41% of key missile design issues with FRP shells & propulsion technologies. Optimized missile and spaceflight component weight, achieving a 24% reduction. Increased missile efficiency by 19%. Tested various metals and polymers for spaceflight applications. Coordinated team efforts to enhance missile functionality and reduce maintenance costs. Utilized SolidWorks for design, ANSYS for validation, and composite structures for fabrication.

Led the design of an automatic trephine punch, valves and solenoid in SolidWorks and Siemens NX Essentials for corneal transplant precision. Engineered an AI-powered cornea transplant device, boosting success by 88%. Collaborated with CSE, ECE & multidisciplinary teams to deploy AI for precise eye localization during surgeries. Achieved micrometre precision in trephine insertion, enhancing accuracy using e-machines and control theory.

Designed and developed a dual-mode rescue vehicle for rapid emergency and flood deployment, integrating a gas-inflation system for instant buoyancy and reliable operation. Improved propulsion efficiency by 52% through iterative prototyping, engineering calculations, and system optimization. Executed the full development cycle from concept trade studies and 3D printing to tolerance stack-up analysis, manufacturing, and technical documentation ensuring robust, scalable performance.

Designed a portable and economical stem cell cryogenic storage system to address the high cost of conventional cord blood preservation. The concept leverages cryogenic-compatible 3D printing and PEEK material to ensure structural integrity, thermal stability, and biocompatibility. Liquid nitrogen is used as the primary coolant to maintain ultra-low storage temperatures. The system emphasizes portability, manufacturability, and scalability for wider healthcare access. The project was recognized with an award when presented as a startup idea, highlighting its innovation and real-world impact.
